overall_summary: The reasoning trajectory demonstrates a pragmatic approach to forecasting with limited historical data (96 hourly points). After evaluating several methods, the analyst selects a naive seasonal forecast due to data constraints, prioritizing simplicity and reproducibility. The approach acknowledges limitations like insufficient data for complex models while systematically addressing seasonality and missing value considerations.
common_data_patterns: No missing values in historical data
key_insights: Limited historical data (4 days) restricts complex model application (e.g., SARIMA/ETS)
Naive seasonal methods are practical baselines for short-term forecasts with clear periodicity
Repetition of the last observed day simplifies forecasting when trend adjustment is infeasible
Data granularity (hourly) necessitates explicit seasonality handling
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex: Balances advanced model considerations with practical simplifications due to data constraints, featuring multi-step evaluation of tradeoffs.
